content: It seems #12548 (and at least one more PR) added a couple of plain-text "Adaptation note"s to master: current master contains 63 of these (as reported by rg "Adaptation note" | wc -l; you can imagine rg is grep). Perhaps it's good to fix those.
I wonder whether besides the PR summary there could be another comment on PRs flagging such things: a sort of "linter with little overhead, using a simple-minded script".
In this case, it could post the output of your rg command, maybe ran on git diff master...HEAD.
Thus, you get the warning, but no action is needed if you want to ignore it.

I got nerd-sniped into writing a style linter against this: #13660. (This fails, because of the current 63 exceptions.) @Kim Morrison feel free to cherry-pick this onto the nightly-testing/bump/... branch, after fixing the current violations.

Damiano Testa said:

I wonder whether besides the PR summary there could be another comment on PRs flagging such things: a sort of "linter with little overhead, using a simple-minded script".

The text-based style linters could fulfill this role...
And I got nerd-sniped again: #13665 rewrites all existing occurrences
Thanks: the fixes, and :peace_sign: the linter.
The fixes have merged now; I've just bors-ed the linter. (Of course, it finds the AdaptationNote tactic :see_no_evil:... which I just allowed.)
